author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In the land of France, a pact is born,
Volvo, Renault with visage adorned,
CMA CGM makes a stance, in time to be sworn,
Electric steeds by 2024, so the heralds have warned.

With euro and sterling held firm in hand,
Dollar's rebound might rebuke this band,
The currency tides, as shifting as sand,
Vulnerability lurks, as per ING's command.

Oil stirs in morning's dim light,
Yet looms a loss, of an ample weight.
Inventories rise, triggering fright,
Brent and WTI face a fateful plight.

feedItems.title: Volvo, Renault, CMA CGM to Produce Electric Vans
feedItems.description: Volvo and Renault will launch a new company, which CMA CGM plans to join, with creation expected in early 2024, and which will operate under its own corporate identity and be based in France.

feedItems.title: Euro, Sterling Look Vulnerable to Any Dollar Rebound
feedItems.description: The euro and sterling edged lower and are vulnerable to further falls if the U.S. monthly jobs data sparks a dollar rebound back toward this week’s multimonth highs, ING said.

feedItems.title: Oil Ticks Higher But Set for Sharp Weekly Loss
feedItems.description: Oil prices ticked higher in early European trading, but were on course for a massive weekly loss, after rising gasoline inventories in the U.S. triggered a sell-off for both Brent and WTI.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
Of metals mixed and gold quite fine,
In London traded 'fore the nine.
Though winds of demand do strive and press,
In markets' cruel, unforgiving caress.

German craftsmen, their orders do wax,
With August's boon, July's loss relaxed.
Factory fires burn, yet not so bright,
Their realm still prisoner to long, fraught night.

Shell, bold in its quest, doth set sights on peak,
In quarter third, a number unique.
Of oil and gas, their coffers brim,
Undaunted by trading's harsh and fickle whim.

feedItems.title: Metals Mixed Amid Demand Headwinds
feedItems.description: Base metals were mixed, while gold edged up in early London trading, with demand headwinds continuing to pressure prices.

feedItems.title: German Manufacturing Orders Beat Expectations
feedItems.description: New orders at German factories rose 3.9% in August, albeit far from fully recovering after plummeting orders in July, indicating a still-fragile environment in the country’s manufacturing sector.

feedItems.title: Shell Production Volumes to Meet Targets
feedItems.description: Shell expects to report production of 880,000-920,000 oil-equivalent barrels a day of integrated gas for the third quarter, and said it expected earnings to be boosted by stronger gas and chemical trading.

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In sprawling markets of Italia's land,
Where BTP and Bund yields stand a yonder,
Doth tilt towards the chasm's wid'ning band,
Yet, hasten not, speaks Citi, and ponders.

Of Nippon's stock, a tale unfolds bleak,
Fell Nikkei under electron's weight,
And energy, its steadiness does leak,
While food and utility stocks relate.

In India's grand Central Bank's keep,
The rate of coin, unchanged it stays,
As inflation, once fierce, now sleeps,
And steadies hence the currency's sway.

feedItems.title: Italian BTP Spreads Seen More Likely to Widen Than to Narrow
feedItems.description: A widening of the 10-year Italian BTP-German Bund yield spreads toward 220 basis points is more likely than a narrowing toward 180bps from the current 200bps level, but the speed of widening might slow, Citi Research said.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Falls 0.3%, Dragged by Electronics, Energy Stocks
feedItems.description: The Nikkei Stock Average closed 0.3% lower at 30994.67 as falls in electronics and energy stocks offset gains in utility and food stocks.

feedItems.title: India Central Bank Holds Rate Steady as Inflation Moderates
feedItems.description: The Reserve Bank of India kept its policy rate unchanged as domestic inflation has moderated.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
Upon the land of morning calm, Agreed was a rule,
But Google and Apple hold them in defile, seen as the fool.
The pursestrings tighten, the ire does swell,
A fine they'll pay, in this tale of hpynotic spell.

In the House of power, an honoured seat lies bare,
Who shall claim it; set upon with staunch and heady glare.
On ties of kin and creed, hinges the mighty race,
In every whisper and claim, a future we face.

Oh, Blue Apron, HelloFresh, purveyors of meal so grand,
In kitchens near and far, they ruled o'er the land.
Yet, fleeting are the patrons, elusive is their grace,
In a market brimming, they struggle to earn their place.

feedItems.title: South Korea Plans to Fine Google, Apple for Breaching Mobile Payment Rules
feedItems.description: South Korea’s telecom regulator plans to fine Alphabet’s Google and Apple a total of $51 million for allegedly abusing their market dominance and breaching the country’s mobile-payment regulations.

feedItems.title: Who Will Be the Next House Speaker? A Look at the Race So Far
feedItems.description: The candidates will depend on personal connections as well as staking out positions on Republican priorities.

feedItems.title: Why Blue Apron and HelloFresh Can't Keep Their Customers
feedItems.description: HelloFresh, Blue Apron and other major meal kit companies struggle to retain customers. WSJ examines how these food delivery companies, big and small, are competing to find and keep customers in a saturated market with an uncertain future.
